page.title: 20Basic Needs Oakley lacks
page.content:
The area's only shop sells mainly{food stuffs and is used as a convenience for odd items. Most housewives travel weekly to{supermarkets in Basingstoke where there are lower prices, wider choice and the convenience of shopping trolleys and free car parks.{Clothing and other basic needs are bought in {Basingstoke's town centre shops.
While local{Infant and Junior Schools provide education for children aged 5 to 11 years, there is no school for older children. Oakley children up to 16 years are bused by the Local Education Authority to Cranbourne {Comprehensive School}in Basingstoke. Kempshott children attend one of 3 comprehensive schools - Cranbourne, Richard Aldworth or Brighton Hill. As the journey is less than 3 miles, no transport is provided.
